Description: Small ovoid vessel of marl pottery with an everted rim and two cylindrical pierced handles on the shoulder. Remnants in red-brown paint of the oars of boats on both sides. Horizontal lines are painted above and over thee handles; a spiral is painted on the base.
Curator's comments: Painted heavily worn. One boat had a zig-zag standard. The rim was decorated with diagonal strokes or cross-hatching, but is very worn. Originally like Decorated ware D 40t in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921) Marked 79 in ink on the shoulder.
